p: RSV regularly occurs in annual epidemics. The US National Respiratory and Enteric Virus Surveillance System (NREVSS) considers that the RSV season starts when the first of two consecutive weeks during which the mean percentage of specimens testing positive for RSV antigen is ≥10 %. The RSV season is considered to have ended in a community when the mean percentage of positive specimens is ≤10 % in reference laboratories for two consecutive weeks.
